title: How to Eject an Xbox One Disc

steps.title: Make sure your Xbox One is on.
steps.content: Make sure your Xbox One is on. You can either turn on the Xbox One by pressing the Xbox logo button on a wireless controller, or by pressing the Xbox logo button on the far right side of the console.

steps.title: Press the eject button.
steps.content: Press the eject button. The eject button on an Xbox One console is located on the right side of the disc slot. Doing so should eject the disc inside the console.

steps.title: Unplug all cables from your Xbox One.
steps.content: Unplug all cables from your Xbox One. Make sure you've got all the cables disconnected from the back of your console, especially the power cord.

steps.title: Bend a large paper clip into a straight line.
steps.content: Bend a large paper clip into a straight line. You'll need the straight end to be about 2-3 inches long. You will need a large-size paper clip for this method because it will need to go in about 1 and a half inches to push the disc out. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Locate the orange/yellow circle.
steps.content: Locate the orange/yellow circle. It's located on the left side of the console, right behind the vents. The eject hole on an Xbox One S is located at the second hole on the left from the right corner and the third hole up from the bottom. It can be more difficult to spot, so it's best to have a good amount of light available.

steps.title: Insert the paper clip into the eject hole.
steps.content: Insert the paper clip into the eject hole. Doing so will cause the disc to pop out a little bit.

steps.title: Use your fingers to pull the disc out.
steps.content: Use your fingers to pull the disc out. Carefully pull the disc the rest of the way out with your fingers. It might be a good idea to use a cloth or soft fabric to protect the disc from fingerprints and scratches.
